category: Accounting Regulations/Article 11 (Time of extinction of claims and liabilities)
contents: Article 11 (Time of Extinguishment of Claims and Obligations) ① In principle, the expiration date of claims and liabilities in accounting shall be governed by the statute of limitations prescribed by relevant laws and regulations. ② In any of the following cases, the statute of limitations is completed. Even before, the relevant claims must be written off as bad debts. 1. If the debtor corporation is dissolved or suspends its business and it is determined that there is no possibility of resumption, the total amount of the costs of compulsory execution and other preferential payment claims shall be seized. 2. If the claims held against the debtor corporation are confirmed as uncollectible following a decision on approval of a rehabilitation plan or declaration of bankruptcy under the Debtor Rehabilitation and Bankruptcy Act, 3. When the debtor dies, the total amount of the cost of compulsory execution and other preferential repayment claims exceeds the value of the inherited property; 4. If the cost of collection exceeds the amount of the claim; ③ Separate debtor or guarantor. If there is a person who will fulfill the obligation, the provisions of paragraph 2, items 1 through 3 shall not apply. Revised August 26, 2021., ④ The results of processing in accordance with each provision of Paragraph 2 shall be reported to the regular board of directors meeting., ⑤ Deleted
